label: 寄席
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Variety halls, highly popular among the middle and lower classes in nineteenth-century Edo. Genres performed at yose included comic monologues, various forms of narration and music, conjuring, magic lantern shows, and much else. (Also yoseba 寄席場.)
